meanings.definition: Compulsion by threat or force; coercion.
meanings.sent1: She signed the contract under duress.
meanings.sent2: The suspect confessed under duress from the interrogator.
meanings.sent3: The cat reluctantly took a bath, feeling under duress.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches bent under the duress of the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The student's anxiety increased under the duress of the upcoming exam.

meanings.definition: Constraint or pressure caused by threats or intimidation.
meanings.sent1: The hostage remained calm despite the duress of the situation.
meanings.sent2: The duress of the deadline made him work faster.
meanings.sent3: The duress of the crowded room made her feel uneasy.
meanings.sent4: The duress of the competition pushed him to perform better.
meanings.sent5: The duress of the storm forced everyone to seek shelter.

meanings.definition: Under pressure or threat; in a state of compulsion.
meanings.sent1: She made a duress decision under the circumstances.
meanings.sent2: The duress situation required immediate action.
meanings.sent3: The duress student quickly finished the assignment.
meanings.sent4: His duress expression showed his discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The duress atmosphere in the room was palpable.
